title: Brit couple and baby jailed in US after 'accidentally swerving' over Canadian border
text:

A British couple claim they have been thrown into jail in the US after swerving across the US border from Canada to avoid hitting an animal.

David and Eileen Connors were on holiday with their three-month-old baby in Vancouver, when they say they veered onto a dirt track - but after continuing down the road they were stopped by US border guards.

The family, who were also with David's brother Michael Connors, his wife Grace and their two-year-old twin girls, were all chucked in prison amid claims that their explanation was "unequivocally false", according to officials at the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

Eileen said in a statement that the family will be "traumatised for the rest of our lives", adding her baby has been forced to endure squalid conditions and has developed an eye condition.

(Image: ICE)

At one point, according to the statement reported by The Philadelphia Inquirer , her son was left naked for several hours in a cold jail after his clothes and blankets were taken for washing.

She said: "When I ask how am I supposed to keep my baby warm in this horrible cold, all they tell me is to put a hat on him."

"They even took away one of his formula containers, which I had to beg for three days for them to return it to me."

Eileen added that the blankets given to her and her son "smelled like a dead dog".

The row comes amid already simmering tensions between Britain and the US after an American diplomat's wife was accused of killing Brit Harry Dunn in a hit-and-run before fleeing the country.

(Image: ICE)

The family's lawyer, Mrs Cambria, said: "They had no idea they had crossed any boundary. They had no idea they were even in the United States.

"They were just trying to get back to their hotel."

Aldea - a legal services provided - has complained to the US Department of Homeland Security's inspector general, and Mrs Cambria said that although no paperwork has been provided, it is likely the family will be deported back to the UK.
description: David and Eileen Connors' say their three-month-old baby was also put in prison and has reportedly developed an eye condition
